revised_title: Daily Variation of Horizontal and Dipping Needles: Observations and Experiments
tldr: The author, Peter Barlow, conducted experiments on the daily variation of horizontal and dipping needles. He observed that the motion of the needles varied depending on their direction and concluded that the daily change was not produced by a general deflection of the earth's directive power but by an increase and decrease of attraction from a specific point. The exact nature of this attraction and the law of the diurnal change in the dipping needle remain to be determined.
